Well since you have made your class as an abstract one u cannot create
objects of this class. So one way to test this class would be to inherit
this class to a subclass and invoke the respective functions from the
subclass. You don't need to provide an implementation for all the
abstract methods of the super class. If there is a abstract method of
the base class of which u do not know the implementation even in the
child class, then you can throw and UnSupportedMethod exception at
runtime. So u just need to invoke the calls of the super functions from
the sub clas..
 
Naveen Punjabi
USC, Computer Science

Subject: [junit] how to test abstract class



Hi: 
    there is a question confuse me. I have a abstract class and it has
some method which not abstract method.Now ,whether i must test it? 
    how to test ? help me. 
Ex: 
    public abstract class Parent 
      { 
          public void Dosomething1() 
            { 
                .......... 
            } 
          public void Dosmoething2() 
            { 
                ........... 
            } 
          abstract public void Do1(); 
          abstract public void Do2(); 
      } 
    public class Child1 extends Parent 
      { 
          ..... 
      } 
    public class Child2 extends Parent 
      { 
         .... 
      } 
    May I test Dosomething1 for Child1 and Child2 separate ? 
best regards.
